column4: Thunderbird hangs when I start it up. How can I make it stop hanging?
Don't  know.  Run from terminal and see if you can tell what is hanging it up.
running 'thunderbird' from the terminal starts it normal, and no messages are reported
Must be that the menu item is pointing to wrong thing....
But after the normal start, it still hangs.
What does it say in the terminal?
No errors. It's just quiet until I finally terminate it, at which point I just see 'terminated'
So did thunderibrd load up and function ok?
It functions for the first... 15 or so seconds, then it freezes.
As for the upgrade, "0 upgraded, 0 newly installed, 0 to remove and 0 not upgraded."
That helped! Looks like it was a theme thing.
Hm, nevermind. It worked for a few seconds, and now is freezing again.
